tD7yRWpZMbFIkidnVRWRHg.text: I'll start by rating the whole place:Great food, good service, nice selection on menu.Now the important bit, my ode to their BBQ sauce:I have to admit, when it comes to a dip,I am known as the condiment slut.Mayo, pink sauce, blue cheese with stinky force,When it comes to this BBQ dream there is a but...But why are you so smokey, so sweet and delicious.When you cover my chips, every one is so precious.I can squirt you, and dip in you and smother my food,"can you pass the BBQ sauce?", "Get your own dude!"

YKJi2vLCBO4m6YwVXJhOjA.text: fantastic ribs!! and i love the pulled pork it just melts in your mouth.Some great deals on for £10, you need to be hungry for this place

X4CJeZ-3C95z5zoAEoayfg.text: Beer and a big carnivore-ish blow out = Bodeans. If know what pulled pork is, and love licking ribs this place is for you!That said, I've eaten a lot of the double vege burgers and they are also v.good. The atmosphere is is very wanna-be Texas sports bar, there is always baseball or American football, it's relaxed and v.friendly staff. Don't go on a first date (or the second for that matter)... but you'll know you are comfortable with each other when you're ok with rib juice trickling down his chin and a splotch of ketchup on your hoodie.

ny19QRurJ1Nc-acnMHsSkw.text: The double stack of fried vegetable-mash patty I got in a burger bun along with two little corn bread muffins presented an amazing value at £5.95, but the only thing that made me eat it with relish was the BBQ sauce (both sweet and spicy) I smothered it in before eating the patties alone with a fork and knife.  Sans the BBQ sauce, it would have just been a bog-standard vegetarian burger from a completely forgettable London eatery.  To prove that my rating isn't just a vegetarian bias, Robert D got a combo plate with a quarter of a chicken, a rack of ribs, and pulled pork.  He said the only thing really notable about the plate full of food was the pork, as the chicken was just, well, chicken, and the ribs were overcooked.  The cornbread only tasted like the real deal when a slab of butter was placed in the middle of it and allowed to melt.  Mmmm... cornbread.The people at the table next to us got rib platters, and theirs looked different to the overcooked ones on our table.  They also got them with heart-attack-inducing chilli cheese fries.  Those looked intense.The downstairs restaurant was cozy, albeit confusing.  The antelope antler wall lights, the tartan carpets, the wood-panelled walls... the decor screamed more North American mountain lodge than it did deep south BBQ joint.  The service was a bit slow, but the friendliness made up for it.Overall, Bodean's was, well, probably the best BBQ you'll find in London because it has absolutely 0 competition, but by true American standards, it was wholly disappointing.  So I'm meeting in the middle at 3 stars.  I would only return if I had a hankering to obliterate my main course completely to the point of rendering it unidentifiable by smothering it in some sweet, hot, delicious BBQ sauce.  Which I'm sometimes wont to do.

O4i01lcLx7WJ6QeFxWNJ5g.text: BBQ.  Nuff said!I could always watch my favourite American sporting events and have some amazing pulled pork.  Out of all the locations, this is my least favourite, which is funny because it is the main one, but still a great time.

CDrdn_ECpd30u3z4G5gosw.text: Awesome. I eat here once a week. Always upstairs where the action is. I love the pulled pork sandwich but sometimes go for the ribs. Coleslaw is great and the chipotle bbq sauce is so amazing that I drown my food in it. Goes great with a cold beer or even a Root Beer which they serve! ***** Ate there last night again and discovered that Bodean's now serves Sierra Nevada Pale Ale, the best beer in the world. Another one of my London favourites. If you haven't eaten here then you're missing out.

1ZBeBxYt8y-EDhd33Dv1nQ.text: I went here the other day with some colleagues during a lunch break and it was totally worth the meat-fest that it was. Ordered a half portion of back back ribs, with fries and coleslaw and it was just wonderful. We all sat there in content silence after, just digesting. The others ordered burgers, which they proclaimed were equally if not more delectable. And the fries, were crunchy with substance.Service was a little slow at times, but understandably as it was Friday lunchtime and the poor staff were rushed off their feet. Plus, we paid with five cards and the lovely waitress patiently processed the order, card by card. We were sitting downstairs, so it was nice and cosy but my friend who has been here and sat upstairs, says they are more prompt there, as downstairs is for people who have more time and require table service.Really nice place, good food. Bring a big appetite, as you are guaranteed to be stuffed...

yOybla940e4s7bF1J1FgAw.text: I feel sad being an American hunting down American food places in England but that is life.  I can only take going to so many pubs that all serve the same thing.  Barbeque sounded good and of course is a great idea after seeing a play. Then again BBQ sounds good before or after anything.The multiple TVs playing American football and American accents all around sure made it seem like home.  Had the puled pork sandwich coleslaw and beans.  The food was just OK in the end.  The pork was too dry and had to be drowned in BBQ sauce.  The beans were good and the coleslaw was just average.Will I come again, of course where else can I get BBQ in Europe.

WFVZuhVTr6-Sa6rDGBgYqg.text: If you like bbq then you will like this place. Definately try the beef ribs - they are excellent.There is a downstairs if you want more of a restaurant than diner feel. You may have to book in advance as this place gets busy.

y817fhboL162_dnlh6nKgw.text: I stumbled across Bodeans on Saturday night by accident, simply because the Cattle Grid nearby has been closed for good (devastated!). Having seen Bodeans on the numerous occasions on my way to Cattle Grid, I knew it was a safe choice as it is always packed with people. Conveniently I had an American friend in tow and we found it ironic that I would take her to an American style restaurant on her first visit to London. If you like meat, especially eating lots of it with your hands, this is the place for you. There was a 1.5 hr wait for a table downstairs so we waited up top for about ten minutes before we spotted a table leaving. Perfect ... the menu was simple. There were different portion sizes and combinations so you could easily get what you want. I had a full slab of beef back ribs and they did not disappoint (£14.95). The fries were perfection. Even my American friend was impressed with the food and the American football highlights on show. I'd recommend Bodeans for a casual night out. Quick service, no fuss and affordable prices in Soho.

uXrQPof4nP6cCoF3Aut76w.text: I'll say right off that I've never been a fan of food involving a lot of bones. I think part of me would rather ignore the fact it came from an animal. Anyway that means that I cannot appreciate this places specialty, namelyribs. But that does not mean that I cannot enjoy the restaurant. I went for the safe optiona burger. I can honestly say it is the best burger I've had for months. Now I don't have that manybut I probably would if they all tasted like this. The chips that come with it are fairly average, but they would be playing second fiddle whatever. There is an upstairs area that looks like a diner. I prefer the downstairs restaurant section. Dark coloured layout with TVs set to some random US TV station, to complete the 'diner' feel.

8sXJLlaPBL7ljKEow7vApg.text: There is almost no way Bodeans could be any better. The food, atmosphere and service are all absolutely top-notch, and the prices are about half what other, lesser places can charge you. The pulled pork and coleslaw will change your life.

9BNM2VAXbrmefajO5buFOA.text: Greedy Diva @ greedydiva.blogspot.com  If it's big meaty portions of chin wiping, greasy fingers glory you're after, Bodean's is not a bad option. It's probably not Texas, but it might be the most convenient way to imagine you're chowing through a good ol' Texan BBQ in the heart of London. We've been a number of times now, always at the desperate behest of The Peanut Gallery, when he needs his fill of American, cowboy hat wearing, testosterone filled, beer swilling, gut thumping stuff. Or when he wants to watch the football on the big screens. On the ground floor is the casual deli/diner. Downstairs is a dark restaurant which looks like a sports bar. I prefer the ground floor bit. I always go for one of the gigantic hot deli sandwiches (in hamburger buns)  usually the Pulled Pork as pictured (£5.25) with mounds of juicy pulled pork piled on a toasted bun, topped with BBQ sauce. There are also sandwiches with pastrami, burnt ends, brisket, coleslaw, slow cooked pork shoulder, or combinations of the above. The fries are good too. The Peanut Gallery recently tried the beef hot dog (£4.95)  just like any junky-in-a-good-way hot dog to me, although he (being more of a hot dog man) seemed pretty happy with it (although it's not in the same league as Shake Shack's in New York). This was, of course, just a side dish to his BBQ chicken burger (£6.95). I consider it mandatory that all this be washed down with the beer on tap. Preferably while beating your chest and shouting at the big screen. The pulled pork and ribs are the signature dishes. The ribs are enormous. Even the salads are heart attack inducing. I also love the ample trays of USA condiments on offer  condiments make us happy. You've probably been already (there's quite a few branches  we go to the Soho one). If not, for decent quality cow or pig, when you don't want to spend your weekly food budget on some of the limited places in London cooking top notch meat, I think it's a decent goer. If you know a better place for American style barbecue, centrally located, I'd love to hear about it - I'll pass it on to The Peanut Gallery as his birthday present. If you're prepared to pay extra for some of the best pieces of meat in London, go to Hawksmoor or Goodman - but you won't be able to watch the football and howl at the moon while you eat it.

Dn4TvZOx54kH25Kj4HJQug.text: The sauce is great and the bbq is passable.  The burnt ends that I ordered were super dry so the sauce was a necessity.  My boyfriend's pulled pork sandwich was great.  Overall this is a great BBQ joint with reasonable prices.

oirkxA52m9imRso9Fs9B4g.text: When we first got there we were told we would have to wait about 20 minutes or so for a table for two, so we got a drink and stood around chatting for a while, but after only 10 minutes the waitress found us and told us a table was ready. Downstairs is more like a restaurant while upstairs seems to be more like a take out with tables. You order your food, find somewhere to sit, eat and leave. It's a bit more manic, but it has the advantage of pints of beer. For some reason they only sell bottles downstairs. The food is fantastic if, like me, you like animal and plenty of it. I had a "jacobs ladder" while Paul had a selection of chicken, pulled pork (amusingly named shredded bbq pork) and pork ribs. They do an interesting item called "burnt ends". However, it's only available at certain times, so I never got to try it. Paul has had it before and says it rocks... I'll have to take his word for it. The ladder was 5 beef ribs which resulted in a slab of meat about the size of a breezeblock. I nearly managed it all, welllll, I was hungry, ok? Been a couple of times now and enjoyed it both times. You do have to be a meathead to get the most out of the place, but it works for me!

WNXHUeFwchckDjgb0vV7yA.text: SO much meat!! The combo platters are unreal - we're talking half a chicken (BBQ or Jerk), a massive pile of pulled pork (which demands copious amounts of delicious BBQ sauce) AND a set of ribs. It's a large proportion of at least two animals, all for you! And you get chips and coleslaw somewhere in amongst all that delicious meaty goodness. All for about £15. The other thing I like about this place is the selection of decent American beers - perfect to wash it all down with. Ooh, and the grilled king prawn starter is awesome. Definitely recommended.

kOjuPACce6yodLGiqDhsBw.text: Come here frequently if I have friends visiting and it has never disappointed.Great pulled pork. The Soho Special for me is the best option. Chips are average. But it's a great meal and great atmosphere.

9WLaJdl255ingjWNrqCk2w.text: Bodean's in Soho is a carnivore's paradise that I wish I'd discovered earlier. Lovely service, amazingly tasty food and a warm, cosy atmosphere.For my full review, click here: jubbiz.wordpress.com/201…

Xd4DKnBJNX-RcceFA1H9ng.text: I feared the worst as I entered this place on a late saturday afternoon. It was however friendly, efficient and tasty. I had a "pulled pork" sandwich. Sounds vaguely pornographic but it was very nice with BBQ sauce, fries and side salad. Recommended for a meal with mates or a mid shopping trip snack.Sept 2009 - went again - had a combo platter of pork chicken sausages. Stuffed. Three of us ate for less than 40 which for a soho eatery is great value. I have upped my original review from 3 to 4 stars. Discovered the downstairs bit on this visit!! get in here

dOoAJb2EIjTdMnaMAr9soQ.text: I came here absolutely famished and totally unplanned one evening and ordered a beef burger with cheese and a side of chips. I was very satisfied, I only just wish that I didn't have to feel so rushed as my friends and I only got there about 20 minutes to closing time. The food is American BBQ, with a menu filled with meaty dishes of burgers, ribs, lamb, pork and chicken. I want to go back and try their baby back ribs, which comes with fries and coleslaw, and this time I hopefully won't be so rushed!

46iCOqKby7eVbddg1mLgnA.text: As an American I have to say this is pretty good St Louis style BBQ. Portions are massive and without a reservation you have a bit of a wait but worth it for a good meal. Definitely come hungry and if you have room for dessert I recommend the milkshakes with an added shot of bourbon! Dress is casual and the atmosphere is chill.

g8car5r_0AZujrnzL2jmFw.text: Me and the gals had a truly lad-dy night of carnivorous platters and beers at Bodeans over the weekend, and I think i'm still high on the vast levels of meat I managed to stuff my face with.  Bodeans offers everything from delicious sticky ribs to tender pulled pork and burnt brisket ends.  All portions are served with a generous helping of chips, coleslaw and lashings of barbecue sauce.When it comes to sauces, I can't get enough.  Ketchup, salad cream, mint sauce, cranberry sauce, bread sauce, redcurrant jelly - you name it, I want it; but the combination of the ginormous meat platter with sticky barbecue sauce was just the business.  The meat platter was £22.95 between 2, but cheaper items on the menu include pulled pork and burnt ends baps from £6.95.  With branches in Soho, Clapham, Fulham and Tower Hill, you're bound to be near one, so there's no excuse not to check it out.If the neon pink pig sign with 'BBQ' emblazoned across its podgy little tum doesn't do it, the 2 lonesome fish dishes will soon give vegetarians the message - MEAT RULES!

9njtHKLHAQ12KNm-jw9mbA.text: Went for the weekdays 'game day special' it was fantastic can't go wrong with full rack of ribs, wings, fries, colslaw and a beer for £15 what great value. I have been here before but was put off by the insane ques and inability to book a table for less than 8 people. But this was worth the wait. The food was lovely ribs nice and soft, wings big and succulent chips well cooked. I might have to re visit if I can bring myself to cheat on my favourite red dog.

XOvEBSN9Na4EZ2FUIEfq9g.text: OH MY GAWWWDDD! The pulled pork sandwich is DELICIOUSNESS personified! I'm allergic to wheat yet I suffered the consequences just so I could eat this porky delight. Boy was it worth it!

bOEYcgzhoIk4d62bkDvbLQ.text: Went here for lunch on Saturday and sat downstairs. Food was good (the Soho Special sandwich was great and regular size is definitely big enough), service was prompt and price was reasonable. Only thing I'd say is the tables are a bit tightly packed in.

rJSjoEX7098JhIb1muwx5A.text: The food was okay but...Hosts had a stinking attitude. We were told to wait two hours on Friday night. When we came back there still wasn't a table. So I said, "it's nine, how much longer will we have to wait?" They just couldn't tell me. They didn't originally give us an approximation, they told us two hours. Luckily, a table opened up after about ten minutes but the food wasn't worth the wait. It was okay but not great. If you've had real American BBQ, don't go expecting it to be that good. If you lower your expectations - you'll be okay. To add insult they automatically add an optional service charge of 12.5%. Would have been more inclined to give had it not been there. The service was basic not spectacular.

5SavIHTdYprkIEYqilGBhg.text: First time to this small chain and had a nice meal in the deli-up section - I liked that because it was pretty relaxed even though it was busy.  I tried the "best sandwich in town" (Soho Special) which seems debatable as I had earlier had what was definitely a rival sandwich in Exmouth market (yes, I did eat two enormous pork sandwiches on the same day, but I know you won't judge me because you're on Yelp and you love food).  I would say it was a little on the mushy side, but it tasted good what with all the sugar and the vinegar and tomato and pork.  I think it could be improved with more crunchiness from the Burnt Ends that were allegedly in there.  Two of my friends had the Baby Backed Ribs/Pulled Pork combo which they enjoyed, another one had the beef brisket sandwich.  I thought it was quite reasonably priced, especially the sandwiches.DISCLAIMER: I also enjoy Tony Roma's especially on Tuesday and Wednesday when I can get a starter (i.e. half onion loaf) and main course (i.e. half rack of ribs) for £9.95 so possibly don't trust my taste in BBQ (or, indeed, food at all)...UNLESS: you are in Williamsburg, Brooklyn NY in which case I can tell you that there is quality BBQ at Fette Sau, owned by the same folks as run Spuyten Duyvil, an excellent bar just across the road.

k-Ix-l9jPL6TIylFKHysCw.text: Went here for a friends birthday, staff are great and it's a good place to go if there's a group of you. Menu is pretty much all based around BBQ'd meat - although there is a couple of Veggie options). Meat is delicious especially the Burnt Ends (Beef Brisket served either 'wet' - with bbq sauce or 'dry' without) but not to impressed by the fries and coleslaw that make up the sides, which is a shame as the all the meat options I tried where delicious ( I think the chicken that I nicked off of my fiances plate was the best - really juicy with a lovely marinade!). Sides nice just basic. Overall a little pricey for what it is but still a good night. Defiantly recommend booking as it gets really busy. Go with an empty stomach as some of the portions are generous!

SaboCUVmH9u8wWE62Sc5eg.text: Oh Bodean. You make me wait. And wait and wait and wait. Outside, on your benches, provided for me, and all the other waiting companions, at which we drink your bar drinks, one by one, until, finally, my name is exclaimed, and gloriously struck off the 'list' whence I may then dash inside to sooth my carnivore cravings, having been tormented by the teasing wafts of BBQ meats.A frenzied consumption of slow cooked pork and deep fried carbohydrates smothered in spicy mayo follows. But you must know the protocol to optimise your experience here:You will have to wait, and it normally doesn't matter if you opt to sit up (diner style) or downstairs (more restaurant like), expect at least an hour for dinner on a week night, longer on weekends. Also don't fall for the pulled pork, if that's all you crave, and crave-you-it-only, go to Pitt Cue around the corner. Bodean's is about the 'burnt bits'. The Soho Sandwich is a damn good sandwich, and trust me the medium sized one is enough, no matter how ravenous your wait has made you, the large will defeat you in almost any case, or leave you uncomfortably over-fed if your ethics object to you leaving anything but a clean plate (ahem...).The cocktail list is great, the 'old fashioned's come real-boozy too, y'all. The prices are jolly decent. If you want ribs go for the baby-back rack, every time.

FtIIdPCaGCB5wY2MaUsv9Q.text: This place is epic. It's an American based dinner type place. Wings, ribs, pulled pork, brisket you name it they do it. I had the game day special which is £15. 4 ribs, 4 wings , pulled pork, slaw and chips are...Ohhh and a beer. This isn't served in a Friday or Saturday. The second time I went Me and my fiancé had a 2 person sharing meal that was 2 pieces of chicken 6 ribs, pulled pork and brisket. Both meals were very nice and I would I mean will be returning. A quick tip try to book as this place gets very busy at lunch time and evenings.! Enjoy.

-ZE5jG0dBYzQbOMc03mAPQ.text: This is a review for this specific Bodeans (I like the one in Tower Bridge), but this one is slow and just doesn't taste as good, it feels like the food has been rushed.  And to top it off, the last time I went my eating partner had a mouldy bun. I complained for her and the waiter tutted and walked off.  I called him again and he said that the buns had come in that morning so it want possible. This despite us showing him the green mould.  Finally after 10 minutes we got a replacement.

PcM9CV8wMMfGql5LZO40aA.text: My poor heart, what have you done to it Bodeans? It went from spick and span to an orgy of cholesterol, probably immediately after the first time. My poor mind, it went from clean living to a blunderbuss of pulled pork addiction, again probably immediately after the first time.My poor smile it went from a wry smile to a massive grin after the first time.Our version of American style BBQ? I think so! Sweet succulent meat falling off the bone, ribs - rubbed, marinated and soft, the chicken wings a delight, you can get a massive meal with a drink or two for under £20. It's in Soho, so lots options before or after but I would certainly come here with a very empty stomach.They have two areas; a more casual diner area (slightly longer opening hours and faster service) upstairs with long tables and a restaurant area downstairs which is harder to get to late in the evening. You can't book unless you're a large group but bizarrely you get a lot more for your money downstairs. Go there, but be careful you might not get back up the stairs.Why doesn't this get 5 stars? I couldn't get into the restaurant bit the last time!

cEubOUxq0JlV4eLdqdlz5w.text: Good BBQ in London?  HA!What's next?You gonna tell me that Indian food is more popul...wait...nevermind.Carry on.Rub.

zVNpg3T50guHp15N583y5g.text: Food was really quick and as always a good amount of food and tasty :) however i wasn't pleased to find a fly in my cocktail....and the second drink then served to me was then overcompensated for in a lot more alcohol and peach puree....not one for cocktails.

jNEhd3wO-h21htIMJEUXmg.text: Biologically I'm half-Jewish but my dad got thrown out of his synagogue-led Boy Scout troop as a youngster for bringing pork sausages to a picnic, so I've not exactly been brought up on a kosher diet. Which is a good thing because there are pigs-a-plenty on offer at Bodeans . . . along with chickens and cows . . . and not a whole lot else.  They know what they're doing and they stick to it: lots and lots of meat, in all its many guises, mostly covered with a thick layer of barbecue sauce. Ribs, wings, legs, thighs, pulled pork, burnt ends (nicer than they sound).  There are sides but they're largely ignored in diners' quests to get as much protein down their faces as humanly possible, and this was perhaps the problem for me.I love meat.  But I like it with other stuff too.  The meat at Bodeans is doubtless amazing, but - and there is a but - if that's the kind of meat that you like.  All-American, chargrilled, dripping with barbeque sauce, full-on protein-fest.  It all looks the same and frequently tastes it too.  Not that the same is bad - it's a good same! - but nonetheless, it was difficult to differentiate the chicken from the hunk of pork until (and sometimes after) I'd bitten into it.I was with ten people and we ordered four meat platters between us.  Half of the group consisted of big South African men and the rest of us were hungry and enthusiastic yet we still barely dented the offerings.  You certainly can't fault the generosity, nor the staff members (all cheery and helpful), and value for money is extremely good.  We even had doggy bags to take home the (considerable) leftovers - truly, we were living the American dream.Unfortunately, much as I would love to describe myself as a full-on carnivore, I'm a fan of the old veggies too.  I mainlined the small portion of coleslaw, hidden under a wedge of beef, before anyone else could get their sauce-drenched hands on it.  There are salads on the menu, of course, but since even the side portion of BBQ Beans come with the proviso "contains meat", I wasn't overly excited by their presence.  Everything was heavy and hard work to chew.  They're not promising gourmet cuisine but even so, would a few corns on the cob or tomatoes be so amiss?!Having said all of that, I still managed to stuff an unholy amount of meat into my mouth, and gleefully helped myself to a doggy bag.  For £20 a head, I had a cocktail, a beer, more meat than I could shake a stick at and dinner for the next two days.  Now that's good value. Unfortunately I was also so full that I could barely sleep some five hours later, and woke up suffering from meat sweats the following morning . . . so good as those burnt ends were (and they really were), I'm just not sure it's worth the pain.  I'll return, but not until my internal organs have recovered.

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Not even the vegetables are vegetarian.

sgEBGvxm8ztqOq1AYsVBzQ.text: We had to wait for about an hour for a table, which is a good thing if you're familiar with American Psycho. This seems to be the joint in Soho that everyone wants to be at. I ate a ridiculous amount of carbs. Cheeseburger with fries, onion rings and also a vanilla milkshake and then a cheesecake for desert. I went to carb city and boy was it worth it for the size 10 outfit to feel tight at the end hahhaa. The cheeseburger and milkshake were awesome. The fries were bland and I'd skip the cheesecake next time. But overall greattttt.

BxfThMA9WPa_IL_ecTTfFA.text: Yum, pulled pork and burnt ends. I ate a whole pile of meat and walked away so happy. I'll definitely be back. Some of my friends were inspired by their selection of Texas beers.Gluten-free notes: Their BBQ sauce is gluten free, according to an email I exchanged with the company. Cool! Most BBQ sauces are full of soy sauce which is full of wheat.

dN3HpYSGYKy6YR-SbyHhnQ.text: The quality of the food really knocked me back.  Caught up with a couple of friends on the downstairs level.  Four different meals and all brilliant.  KC Brisket Sandwich, Pulled Pork, Ribs, and Tri-Tip all highly recommended.  Well done all involved.

BvnagLEeZdxSEXSev6lBVg.text: This is the best bbq restaurant in London hands down! The soho sandwich is crazy good and always my regular order. Pulled pork and burnt ends in a sandwich!! Too good! Good prices as well. The wait on the seated restaurant can take a while but if your not too fussed you can just sit upstairs.

ZmZ0Cys8HwAi3FykKCw55w.text: Great lunch time spot for some good food at reasonable prices. Their 'Soho Special' is the go to for a quick cheap but delicious lunch. I would also recommend their ribs and grilled chicken burger BBQ or Jerk. Also definitely go for the seasoned fries.

nrjy8uFvgeMnrW5REptiOw.text: Their 'Soho Special' is, without a doubt, the most delicious burger I have ever tasted in my whole entire life. My first time here and I honestly couldn't have had a more enjoyable time. Looking forward to becoming a regular.

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Soho Special burger - pulled pork and burnt ends. The most delicious burger I have ever demolished.

jtY4EOLrAoKMjgpByf3Saw.text: Great place to get my American BBQ fix! We tried some ribs as well as the pulled pork and both were delicious. Moist meat + tangy sauce= wonderful.It was ridiculously packed on a Friday night and the wait for a table was over an hour but we managed to sneak into a table in the bar area. Nice lively atmosphere and good food!

BgsXyn7O3SMpGi3KtO0qeA.text: My go to spot for American Sports and beer. The food is good. Burgers, hot dogs, ribs, wings and the standard BBQ faire. All come piping hot. Good TV's, overall this place is great at what it does.

-o04DJbNgE8Fn6ThzF-Gug.text: I think Bodeans has jumped the shark. When it first arrived it was great but after a few disappointing visits we've pretty much written it off. The service and quality of the food is so inconsistent and that's what puts me off.   But! If you are going to go I would recommend the burnt ends. When they're good they're really good!

-_uIDX0bGyHkzd1AHo11QQ.text: Perfect meal after a long day wandering round the sights of London's West End.The portions are huge and the prices are reasonable, given the location and the high quality of the dishes.This is not fine dining - expect to eat with your fingers (why else would they give you a roll of kitchen towel with your cutlery?!)

OE1qwg3bKhp_sKy_1mxSFA.text: Bodean's is great for groups of all sizes. We went with a group of 12 and we only had to wait 20 minutes to be seated. The food is great, and the barbecue sauce at Bodean's is fantastic! The portions at Bodean's are very generous and you'll leave feeling very full. The blue cheese dip and the chicken wings are a must!

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom

iVRtUscxu1KUr4DmxSu_jA.text: Bodean, is a mini American BBQ chain spreading across London, while the food are not exquisite or somewhere you would take on a date, the BBQ items are generally at a very decent level. My pulled pork sandwich was such a lunch treat, finely seasoned and marinated moist meat sandwiched between a soft bun, couldn't fault it, far cheaper than Big Easy but quality wise for me was just the same if not better.

1WQkPggCeOrVro9CZ35jGw.text: Great restaurant with a buzzing atmosphere. The portions are huge (which we guessed after having looked at the menu) so we avoided starters. I only managed to finish half of my main course! It was incredibly delicious and there are a range of sauces available on the table. The restaurant is quite small and you can tell they've tried to pack as many tables inside as possible.. we were very close to the next table, I could hear their entire conversation! The cocktails are good too and unusual. Absolutely loved our waitress, very friendly and bubbly. One downside was having to wait about 30 minutes for a table despite booking in advance. However, the wait was worth it as I left with a full stomach plus leftovers!

IUXepfZpiKj0hqdQYe0piA.text: Staying on my fat American theme, this place exceeds expectations in food portion for a London spot. =DI got the regular sized Boston butt (they had a large) and it was huge!! Tasted great (but a little dry, although nothing that a table-side bottle of bbq sauce couldnt salvage). Service friendly and teeming w american football fans on NFL game nights. They even keep the place open past close time for the game.Cool place. But don't get the pabst, you'd be severely overpaying for quality of beer just because it's an 'import'

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Boston butt

HEhy1ens0Ynwl-PF8T6xyw.text: Meh. It's ok pub food, but it's definitely not 'cue.We got the hot wings, "NFL special" (3 hot wings, pulled pork, baby back ribs, coleslaw, sweet potato fries, a bottle of Bud) and a hot chicken burger.The hot wings were a hot mess. They were barbecue wings (down to the smoky flavour and sweet barbecue sauce) doused in hot wing sauce (which was pretty solid on its own merit, though it included habaneros and Scotch bonnets which, while lip-tingling, are very much not a part of Buffalo wing sauce in any tradition) and served with that pre-packaged foamy "blue cheese dressing" that the UK seems to shove into every "American" establishment which tastes nothing like blue cheese (or dressing, for that matter). Seriously, at this point, can you just give me ranch? Or maybe some blue cheese shoved into sour cream? Anything? Also, a full order of wings with two (2) celery sticks is sort of ridiculous.The pulled pork was only ok. It was dry and lacked complexity. The ribs were by far the highlight: tender, a little sweet, smoky. Tasty stuff. The coleslaw was adequate, as were the from-the-freezer sweet potato fries (though the 2.25 up-charge from regular fries is cheeky, guys). The chicken burger was forgettable.What got my goat about this place was the fact that it claims to be a 'cue joint when it's clearly not. There's no actual authenticity to anything: this is a Britified version of "generic chain restaurant barbecue" that you'd get in some part of the States that doesn't do hardcore 'cue (anywhere north of the Mason-Dixon line, basically). I wasn't hoping for something like tangy North Carolina-style or saucy South Carolina 'cue, but I wasn't actually expecting totally generic, either.Service was more interested in texting than working, and we had to practically tackle our waitress to get the bill.Get the ribs. Don't get the Bud. Don't get the wings. And if you know a place to get something closer to barbecue (or Buffalo wings, for that matter) in London, for the love of all that is divine, let me know.

tVMj4ZUZCbTPCsS095xx9w.text: If you like meat (in the way that you like eating it. Lots of it) this is the place for you. Every time I have family in town I bring them here and every time it's a spot on hit! Since it's a very popular place and they don't take reservations, it can build up a quite long queue though, especially on fri-sun nights. Luckily they have a system so you put your name down, and then you can go to the pub across the street and enjoy a pint or two until they text you and say your table is ready! They also have an entire selections of sauces on each table, everything from hot bbq to mustard, which I enjoy quite a lot. I like sauces.

zxkQSTAw9ZSTBRVh2-HYMg.text: The Tri-tip sandwich is incredible. If you know what Tri-tip is then you'll know how hard it is to come by. Bravo.

j8VmkfHlS2VNntZ2WaSyrQ.text: I came to the area after work, with the specific intention of getting a plate full of tasty meat for dinner.  This place is permanently packed with like-minded people with similar taste preferences.As I was just by myself, it was relatively easy to get a seat immediately.  However, I noticed that if I were in a pair or a larger group, there would have been a bit of a wait.I got the meal with burnt ends and pulled pork.  This came with fries and coleslaw and I rounded it off with a pint of beer.  The flavours were good, but it actually felt a bit too dry and stodgy for my liking.  Not juicy enough.  It actually felt like a task to finish it all.The people there were pleasant and I never felt that I was waiting for long, even though it was a pretty busy night.

24ltnIjqbmrW3SL2kxGHmA.text: Excellent food... Fast and friendly service.  Great for the kids- really couldn't ask for anything more.

xJ5MOgCu8Ulxzy1ToZjbxA.text: Phenomenal BBQ food. The food is fantastic, and the service is good. But it can get quite busy as you can't reserve a table unless there are 7 or more people. To be honest the food speaks for itself and the beer choice is great. One downside is that is is more expensive than your average BBQ. Worth the extra moolah?.... Yes indeed!Go for the Burnt Ends. They're the best I've had.

VabA0AW9F0kFwjn3owiKFw.text: Highly recommend you visit this Bodeans Sunday to Thursday for the £15 game day special. It really is special! The first thing to think about is getting a table - you have two options, turn up early enough (6pm ish) in a small group, or turn up, book, and they'll call you back when they have a table. We did the latter as there was 6 of us, and went for a pint at a pub around the corner. We were told an hour wait at least, but 40min later we were in. The 'Game Day' meal itself is truly excellent. Gorgeously cooked baby back ribs, chicken wings with a sauce to die for, nice (but very salty) chips, dry style coleslaw and a beer - can't really go wrong. The decore is exactly what it looks like - American style diner. You have the option of sitting, canteen style, upstairs, or restaurant style, downstairs - both are fine.Overall, come for the game day special, as long as you can get in, though I would argue that places like Red Dog do arguably better food, Bodeans Game Day Special is without doubt the best value 'American BBQ' style food going.

LUFr4RgG0qKlPUMU2lFPxw.text: Quick, delicious, meaty with super friendly, helpful staff. Apparently burger buns would require some upgrade as they fall apart with first bite, but since I belong to the category of gluten sensitive = bread avoiding, chips loving individuals, there is nothing to complain about. Zero. Considering this place fast food restaurant, they even offer lemon infused wipes..

Df9NHMoBbhb9EhNaE-DLeg.text: One word to describe Bodeans: love. As a North American, this is my favourite place to eat in jolly ol' Londontown. The food is great, very North American menu. The atmosphere is great. The service is pretty good for London standards (aka lack of customer service in most places), they tend to be pretty friendly especially at Tower Hill. It is always jam packed. I have visited two of their locations in London, Poland Street and Tower Hill and I would have to say we preferred Tower Hill as it was less busy than Soho (where you are pretty much guaranteed an hour wait- no reservations) and it was nice to be able to have a nice walk around Tower Bridge after devouring as much pulled pork as we could handle. Do get the pulled pork, its awesome. Don't get the ribs unless you enjoy them extremely dry. One of the great joys in life is pulled pork and ribs. However, at Bodeans I have repeatedly ordered the ribs and have been disappointed each time. The last time I ordered them, they were so overdone that they were actually burned at the ends. There is nothing this girl loves more than a barbecue done right, but the state of the ribs brought a tear to my eye this time. The chipotle sauce is awesome, buy a bottle to take home. Yeah, its that good. Bodeans has a Barbecue Bloody Mary on its drink list. Sounds amazing, no? This is not something for the weak spirited. The server's reaction when we ordered it: Are you crazy?! And this is a fitting response. What is a Barbecue Mary, you ask. One word describes this concoction: insane. Think a barbecue version of a traditional Bloody Mary, garnished with a full piece of bacon and made with smoked vodka. Yes, you read that right. Smoked vodka. Does it work? To a degree. It is the strangest tasting drink I have ever tried. I'm not a fan of this one. To be honest, I'm disappointed I didn't like this drink as its pretty much the collision of two of my great loves in life: Bloody Marys and good ol' barbecue. Try it if you are strong willed. But you will understand what I mean by the weirdest tasting drink ever. It kind of works though. Kind of. On the other hand, the Long Island Iced Teas go fabulously with a full barbecue meal. If you're a fan of a good barbecue, this is the place for you. If you know of another barbecue place on par with Bodeans in London, do let me know!

9lxzBvUAVzrdCI8xhBiz-g.text: Just a brief one: this place will raise your standards for pulled pork like nobody's business. So far only Louis Pretty in Berlin has been up to the challenge, although they cheat by sticking it in a bun and covering it with melted cheese.

c7PDoZohAqmbjMiOnwW-vg.text: The pulled pork sandwich is delicious! Also had the wings which you get for free on Tuesday with a loyalty card, so yum! Really good value for money as well.

_xbbsM6PZ3F-ekSPuftZzA.text: Delectable ribs + unbeatable BBQ sauce = mmmmmmSome of the best ribs I've had!  The BBQ sauce was so delicious my friends and I practically used the entire bottle -- very flavorful and spicy.  I coated everything in sight with it, it was so good!  It can get a bit crowded for sporting events, so plan ahead.

5ir_DcfIUz27dnJ2b0WfXQ.text: Went here last Friday with friends after having a few drinks. Not my fav chain but the others were keen to give it a go. Told that I wasn't able to order neither a pulled pork sandwich nor a burger I asked what I was allowed to order... the cashier told me only ribs.These arrived piping hot... too hot. It was clear from the off that they had been microwaved. The member of staff who served us said they weren't but after asking another member of staff he agreed that this was their method of preparation later in the evening.Absolutely vile, tough and chewy.

dttEV3p929DA59_iqID5_A.text: I could review this restaurant in one word: meat. But to expand on that, this place has built up something of a legendary status within my social circle. You get a lot of food for what you pay, and I don't remember ever having to wait more than five minutes or so between ordering the food and it being bought out to the table. My personal favourite is the Soho Special: essentially a large bap filled with a monstrous amount of juicy, tender pulled pork. Slather everything with hot sauce, tuck in and try not to think about what it's doing to your arteries. Job's a good 'un.

oUaZCnFWgduCeXYpC8d-Lw.text: Not a bad BBQ joint, by any means, but not a great one either. Thanks to the erupting volcano underneath the Eyjafjallajoekull glacier in Iceland, my flight home was canceled earlier today and I'm stuck in London for an indefinite period of time. So, I was feeling a little nostalgic for American food. When I heard about Bodeans, it was a no brainer. Not too far from where I'm staying, I headed into SoHo and found Bodeans in no time.I was at first surprised that when they bill the joint as a BBQ deli, DO take that literally. There is no server that takes your order. You get a seat, look over the menu, and head up to the deli counter (often times, waiting in line longer than you'd like to), order, pay, and then get a number. When your food is up, they shout the number out. Kinda old school, which is cool, I guess. But kind of a pain in the ass, too. Especially when you want a second (or 3rd or 4th) beer. Get your ass up and go to the counter.Anyway, the food: I got the combo platter, which is really a good amount of food. Granted, it cost £15, which is kinda pricey after the conversion, but it was 1/4lb of pulled pork, a fat chicken leg, and a 1/2 slab of ribs. Plus a ton of chips (or fries if you want to be 'merican about it), a dollop of mayonaisse (blech) and a heaping cup of cole slaw. But, I hate mayo and cole slaw, so I didn't eat it.First of all, let me be clear, the barbecue sauce was great. Just the right amount of tangy and sweet, and just the right amount of spicy and, well, barbecue-y. The meat, however.... well, let's just say, the cooks need to spend a LOT more time in Memphis or Chicago or even NYC to get it right.The pulled pork was good, a little dry, but good. If the sauce wasn't so good, I would have been pissed off. But I tossed some extra sauce on that pile o' pork and got that ish wet! Yummers.The ribs were not my style at all. Oh, I ate the crap outta them, but they were too tough. I think they were cooked at too high a temperature too quickly. Slow and low... that is the tempo!The chicken was straight up underdone. Truth be told, I like my BBQ chicken somewhat blackened and slightly crunchy on the outside. If I take a big ol bite and the skin is rubbery and stretches off the meat... well, that don't exactly work for this pole cat. The chicken meat was entirely too underdone for me. Nuff said.The chips were spot on. But... their fries. Tough to fuck those up. Again, I didn't try the gross mayo or the yucky cole slaw.And I drank two Sam Adams. I woulda had more if I could get 'em quicker. They were good.Conclusion: If I were with some folks who wanted to go, I'd totally go again. But I'd probably get a pulled pork sammich and pass on the ribs or the chicken. If I could have given it 3.5 stars, I would do that. 4 stars is a little much. I give it a 4-star mostly because, well, shit, it's a valient effort in a city that would never make me think of American barbecue. But I take one star away because, well, it misses the mark. If you're in town and you got a hankering, don't hesitate. Go. But tell me you don't agree that the ribs are too dry. I dare you. :)

R8JozMePiMX5elaNJ_Ovfg.text: I feel I have to review this place on two levels. As an American I would say that the BBQ doesn't even come close to touching real American BBQ. In fact, I have yet to find anywhere in the UK that comes close.  However, I have lived in the UK for long enough to say that as far as attempts to do BBQ go it is pretty good.I do like that they attempt to be fairly authentic with such nod as offering burnt ends and that sort of thing. I do sometimes think the attempt to slide in other types of 'spicy' non-BBQ based food muddles the waters a bit.A number of times that I have been there it is clear that a more than a few of the customers are home sick Americans, such as myself, looking for a bit of a BBQ fix. Bodeans can plug the hole and I do enjoy it but it just isn't the real thing.

oqsbVGSeoa6m3qYtaCna7Q.text: I chose to come to Bodean's during the Ghana v US game. And though I'm an American, I was cheering on Ghana since I felt that they had all of Africa riding on them. But anyway... My husband and I arrived 45 mins before the start of the game, and we were glad we had gotten there early! Though we had to get our names on a list we watched as others scrambled to get a place inside the bar or were turned down by the epicly long waiting list. We snacked on onion rings while waiting for their call. Kick-off was getting closer and closer... and just when we were about to give up hope! They called my phone and told us to come downstairs!Not only did our table have an awesome view of their huge tvs downstairs, we were seated and enjoying our Sierra Nevadas before kick-off. Lucky us!Now to the food... as an American who has been to the mid-west... Bodean's BBQ has got it down! Not only was our food cheap for London standards, but the portions were AMERICAN sized! I had the Jacob's ladder ribs and I don't think I've seen so much meat on only 2 ribs before. The burnt ends were also delectable. It just melts in your mouth! I heard the table next to us raving about the mac and cheese... I'll have to come back for that. And the pecan pie, I love pecan pie. And I'll have to come back for the sandwiches... and for the baby back ribs... and for more fries!

H0oPvkYZ6lw9P6AYw9vYVA.text: The first time a came here I went nuts at the food and portions. But since that first time I have decided it isn't as good as it would have been. The location is great, atmosphere tacky, queues terrible. What's this business about not being able to reserve a table for four? It's a joke. We waited nearly 2 hours for a table once. Good points are the nachos starter is one of the best I've had, the beef ribs are good and the double burger great. Only problem is the amount of salt they put in everything. I'm sure my dessert had salt in it too! Pulled pork is nice as are the burnt ends but I still feel they can do better. The upstairs is not worth a visit. The portions are smaller, prices the same and you can lose your seat if you go for a wiz.

9o0LXeP7YdIvJhFXYKdd8A.text: If I could write this review in bold and in a really big font I would just write the word EPIC in really, really big letters that are all fat and epic and stuff. Instead I'm just going to write it with caps lock on, here goes...EPICP.s. The 'small' sized burger thing I got was actually more colossal than anything else. I think an actual tyrannosaurus rex would struggle to finish it.

2NfHTnPNtGzHNDrdrvLKkw.text: My friend hyped this place up so much that i had high expectations which were not met.I opted to go for burnt ends expecting them to be chewy left overs. However, they were juicy, which was fine, but not barbequed enough. I got them with fries and onion rings and despite paying over £12 i still didnt feel full!Also, the woman at the till was a little hopeless. My meal came with a can of pepsi but i wanted a bottle of water. Simple request, but she seemed at quite a loss that i took the pepsi. Would only go again if my mate really wanted to go. i mean, REALLY.

ntjfQOaewd2OLw-nUWwHzQ.text: The best you're going to get in the UK. The pulled pork is simply incredible!

WZgiqUE_Et0MOc4B24Br9g.text: "I want my baby back, baby back ribs" is usually the song that rings through my head when I know I'll be meeting my friend Ben for ribs at this house of meat on Poland street in Soho. We build ourselves up with a pre-game orange juice at the Star & Garter down the road and then it's full steam in to Bodean's with our rib vests attached. If thinking about where to sit on arrival make sure that, even it's busy, you wait for a seat to become free upstairs, rather than down, as the atmosphere and vibe is far superior on the top deck. Then walk up to the counter and proceed thusly; "I would like a full rack of baby back ribs served with coleslaw and fries plus a bottle of beer, all for the low , low price of £10." It is at this point you feel like asking them if this fantastic deal can be true, but ride it out, as it happens to all of us. Sit back, watch some basketball, hockey or baseball on the big screens and prepare yourself for a feast. The food will be with you momentarily. Once it has arrived, go hard or go home. The meat is dangerously tasty and its easy to see why people get fat, because with food like this in the world who needs a salad? Not me. You get a salad. Make sure you spice your ribs up with some of the spicy sauce lying in the handy condiment containers. Keep close by for the obligitary clean up afterwards as you will need your weight in kitchen role to remove the bbq smile you will inevitably end up with. If the baby back ribs aren't your bag, try the Burnt Ends, These are the thing of legend, but because they aren't part of a deal they will set you back about 12 nuggets. Bodean's is in no way, and should never be considered as, a place to bring your girlfriend on a romantic, but if you want to get back to nature and feel that primordial rush as you rip into a pig's rib cage and you schmeer sauce all down your favourite t-shirt, you really can't go wrong.Same again next month please.

gr7cE5-K4HzgMGCbFTyk8w.text: I've seen my fair share of Americana-inspired places in London so I honestly wasn't expecting a lot from this place other than some kind of British-ised version of a BBQ restaurant, but it was actually really really good.  There was some sort of seating area downstairs but the upstairs where I was, was a no-frills order & eat area with lots of napkins on the table.  PERFECT!  Some tv was playing ESPN, which I don't really follow but if that's your thing, it's there.  It tasted like the BBQ place I had at home and I was stuffed.  This review doesn't need to be long, just know that this place is basically what you're looking for if you're looking for American food that won't disappoint!

5r6gYRBVJY2IyDFqnmKYEg.text: Was in London for work, and went to this place as it was right around the corner from my hotel. I saw that it served "authentic" bbq, so I decided to give it a shot. I had the burnt ends beef and the pork ribs, side of fries, and cornbread. I thought both of the meat dishes I ordered were dry. The cornbread was too dense for my liking, as I prefer to to be flaky. Overall, was not a big fan of the food. The only thing I did enjoy was that they were showing American Football.

HnIqT1KC0ZPgHEQcz9KK8Q.text: I love eating with my fingers... and I love BBQ meat. Upstairs Bodeans is your American style rib joint....whilst downstairs it is more formal dining affair.The food is great. ...just gotta loves those burnt ends or holy 'cows ass' as my Indian word colleague calls it. Great burgers and fries too.  Good price good food... what more do you need to know. Its okay for groups though upstIrs it is free seating so if there are more than three of you its hit and miss.It is good for a chilled...hey I am kinda chilled guy...first or second date...or if you have been married for ten years you can be sure your partner won't leave you for going this place. Go... If you get a chance... tell them Agi sent you.... It won't mean a thing to them but it will make me seem really cool when I turn up and say 'Yo I'm Agi'. (I don't actually say yo ) .

g99Ulb6qIr65-WvbnmofPQ.text: It's not the cheapest and the BBQ is not the greatest, though it's pretty good and I often wonder about the people who say it's gone downhill. Maybe it's luck, because I've come here several times and have never had a bad meal. The best thing about this is that it's an American-theme restaurant that Americans will actually step into. I come here and I don't feel embarrassed or like an object of amusement that I'm American. Nobody walking around in ten-gallon hats like the Texas Embassy. Just pretty good BBQ, good American beers (NOT Budweiser), and the ballgame's on. Simple.

Qas-PwjHxA5rWXoOKWAckg.text: I've always had a good experience everytime I go to Bodean's. I always stick with the baby back rips with fries & coleslaw. Delicious. If you're unlucky, you might experience over-cooked ribs. Their wings are really good too. I'm not too fond of their pull back pork. I find it extremely dry and tasteless but a lot of people I know enjoys it. The services is not bad... friendly staff and it's a cosey environment.One thing to note is that if you're planning to go somewhere else after having a meal at Bodean's, you're guaranteed you'll smell of Bodean's!

cfoqxHiSKQ9OUnHicsiheg.text: America in England. Close enough if you miss the old USA. Meat, fries, more meat -- pulled pork, ribs and Cajun fish -- and a good variety of beers. Happy feel in a great location. TVs. Great service.

TZB9ZAIb0pdUkaPj_3umSQ.text: Hey to my American friends! Are you missing American-style protein and pro sports? Well, head straight down to Boedans to scatch that itch! I've sat in a few American sports bars on my U.S. holiday trips, soaking up the atmosphere and sucking up the food and this is a good place to get that vibe over this side of the pond.The menu is protein and carb heavy with BBQ being the main way of cooking. I like their pulled pork and a special treat are the burnt ends, which are only available on certain days of the week. For Brits, I also recommend trying the corn bread muffins and creamed corn, which are typical American side dishes that you can't find easily over here.There are multiple TVs showing American sports so it's worth positioning yourself at the appropriate table to catch the game you're interested in.I usually stagger out, feeling too full but that's all part of the American sports bar experience!

ZJEbZ7-D8oc8lGaDocnBSQ.text: I've been here a couple of times, I must say food is not of my taste. Heart attack on a plate more like it. But if you are after some traditional American meat, this is the place to go

DgLhYkUlcvSYjuTF2oLAsQ.text: As a southern born American I certainly have a bias.  On first entering this BBQ joint they received instant street cred for the bottle of "Sticky Fingers" BBQ sauce behind the counter, a place I used to frequent on commutes between Nashville and Atlanta.  I am only reviewing the upstairs "take away" bit of the restaurant as I have never eaten in the posh downstairs area.  That said, Bodeans is great.  The closest thing to American BBQ I have found.  Not only is it good, but cheap.  They also have a very American style "free refills" policy on soft drinks which makes me happy.  The Soho Special is one of the best BBQ sandwiches I have had, including back in the USA.  I am not even a sports fan, but seeing some American sports does give that bit of comfort to an expat like myself.  Well worth dropping in for an artery clogging mass of meat that will leave you feeling like you should  immediately become a vegetarian as you have reached your lifetime quota for meat.

PGEv5l-cxdNo6rAahxo4dw.text: Burnt ends were TERRIFIC!  Kinda quiet for Sunday NFL football, but hey this is the UK, cheers

mFYumtLvlPl0qSL2f2f4eQ.text: Stopped here randomly as I was looking for a place to eat and this came up on yelp! with all the good reviews I was expecting something amazing....On arrival we was told the wait downstairs to be seated will be around 30 minutes for two people and upstairs we could be seated straight away we chose the latter. Here you have to order and pay for your food at the front counter after this you take your seat and wait for your number to be called. Once you've heard your number being called you identify yourself (put your hand up) and a waiter will bring your food over.Literally 10 minutes after ordering our food came out i was quite surprised as the place was busy and this makes me think that the food was probably microwaved.Between the two of us we ordered a meal and some hot wings. The meal consisted of fries, coleslaw and chicken. The wings where not great!! if it was not for the bbq sauce which I drenched them in I probably would not of eaten them. The main meal was okay the fries and the coleslaw where pretty good however the chicken lacked taste and again was drenched in the bbq sauce.Overall I probably would go back as the concept is good and I like the whole idea however they just need to improve somewhat on the taste of the food!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Fries, coleslaw and chicken with barbeque sauce and mayo.

zIZzv447vpS087eZCMby2w.text: Not bad for British BBQ! Had the burnt ends, which come with fries and coleslaw, a side of bbq beans, and a vanilla shake. The ends were tasty and portion size was generous, though I would suggest ordering them dry and adding your own sauce as they went a little heavy and the sauce here is pretty sweet. The slaw, on the other hand, wasn't sweet enough. The BBQ beans lacked beans (but dipped the fries in the sauce), but the shake was perfect. The children in the family who were sitting beside me were excited to be eating "real American BBQ..." And I'd say Bodeans did a pretty good job of it.

PCuHAacpyTmJvP0fvulJPw.text: When I first came to Bodeans, I liked it a lot but that's purely because I had just their pulled pork. I will stick with my opinion, their pulled pork is absolutely amazing, juicy and delicious but everything else was not. My pastrami sandwich was OK but a bit dry and my companion's Soho Special would be good if it wasn't for the bap. The lady that took care of our table was lovely but the one on the door (at the time) seemed like we were bothering her by coming in. Also, never ever order any cocktails. They are chemical, weak and look like lemonade.

bIyEy34xJojwMyMiixUleg.text: Best bbq outside of texas.  Great service.   Meat was tender and sauce was tasty.  Would definitely return!

IZzdX4jRSn5GmGC34HwqaA.text: There's a reason why there are queues out the door every evening in Soho. This place is good, and these queues aren't artificial. The top floor is rammed packed with people turning up at the last minute. It's common to here there's a 1.5-2 hour wait at it's busiest. However you can often leave your details or wait outside and be seated a lot sooner. Book early, and you'll be seated in the more spacious downstairs, which actually isn't as rammed packed, but you'll need a party of at least 8.The service is excellent. Our waitress was helpful and went out their way to check certain items were available, particularly the milkshakes which they stop making at certain times.Note, come here with your appetite in check, because the portions are deceptively large. The sharing platters, a mixture of ribs, baby back ribs, burnt ends, chicken wings are missions in themselves. Some meat was a little dry but that can be forgiven with lots of BBQ hickory sauce available to slother over your meal. The coleslaw was a little bland, the chips perfectly seasoned.I had the chicken buffalo burger. The meat tender and BBQ'd to perfection. It wasn't particularly big, but I was unable to finish my chips or have room for dessert. Prices are extremely reasonable around £15-20 per head, and if you know beforehand you can also ask for a free item of food based on the day of the week, which is a pretty nice touch. (with a Bodean's Q Card)

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Ribs, Chips and Slaw
Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Sharer - Wings, Ribs, Burnt Ends

YCBr5je-iaplO_JbaF-MQg.text: My favorite thing about Bodeans is that they charge you reasonable prices for what they're serving, making it feel even more authentic. It's chilled out, welcoming, and friendly with a good beer selection. The food is really good. Not the best bbq, but it hits the spot if you're in the mood. They'll take your name and text you when your table is ready. No stupid queuing here!

OOtX738FOL2Yx3NvjPdIog.text: Soho special with coleslaw and tons of sauce! Nom nom nom. The meat was moist and tender and the BBQ sauces complimented the meat perfectly. I like how the bun stayed together, but wasn't so thick that it overwhelmed the meat. The pickles and coleslaw gave the sandwich an extra crunch for texture.The service was awesome. The lady behind the counter was super friendly and there was no hassle when our friend wanted her burger cooked a little more.If I'm ever in need of a BBQ fix, this will be my first stop.

Sd9tc-cjhNvZP8Y-XQ2N2w.text: Cool, clean, sightly loud, and fun atmosphere. Ate the Soho Special, great pulled pork and end sandwich. Nice beers and liquors to pair with it! Lagunitas was on tap here, tastes just like back home in Cali! Id come here again for a bbq sandwich or burger(they look good too). And pair it up with a double Jack on the rocks then continue your walk down Oxnard with a smile and blow all your cash shopping.

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Soho special, lagunitas, and a double jack. Bordeans, London!

9OO1TEzIJC1NsnJprVvV_A.text: IF you are an American, this is your hangout. They have a more upscale downstairs and a very casual upstairs and always have USA football on the TV screens. The day we were here there were some lame Notre Dame students with the cell phones mommy and daddy got them for the semester abroad sitting next to us - rude, and just plain uncool kids. Come on! Other than these dorks, the crowd was a nice mix of UK fans of USA football, and oddballs who wanted American BBQ. We sat at the common table and people were chatty and friendly (again sans the Fighting Irish nerds). Good place to go for a fix of footballs and BBQ. The food was good to Ok, but for BBQ so far away from Chicago or Texas I have to say this place has got to be a must-visit for Yanks in London and especially since you can watch the NFL games here and Chicago is far away.

pL0Ex7na6fytSWhwQIRA-g.text: Interesting American vibe. Friendly staff.Had the brisket, and it was great. Can't wait to try out something else.

cTmTufAip9-2PCWBFdpDCg.text: This was my second trip to Bodean's, but this time at there Soho branch, and i have to say i prefer it to the Tower Hill set up, I like the Soho idea of cuing up and ordering your own food and paying for it there and then, none of this dancing around like a cheerleader to grab the waiter/waitress's attention. Anyway, down to the important bit, the food.  I ordered the burnt ends/ribs combo with a pint of Sam Adams.  The burnt ends were out of this world, tender, juicy and smokey, melt in you mouth stuff.  The ribs were also nice, again smokey and very tender, impressive stuff.  I'd defiantly be coming here again, my new Bodean's of choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Sam Adams on draft, one of my fav's
Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Burnt ends and ribs. Lush.

sBGuHzrkJ6fuYwyFlhWwsw.text: Some dishes are only available downstairs, like the platters (I don't know why). At the Soho branch you have to be a group of 8 or more to book, so if you're less than that you should prepare yourself for a wait or around 30 mins for upstairs or double that for the main restaurant.They have a 'Q Card' which is free and entitles you to free stuf depending which day you decide to go - we got free desserts on the night we were there.We were a group of 7 so were seated in the restaurant downstairs, where there's normal waiter service as opposed to the self ordering system they run upstairs. There's a big range of meat on offer. I opted to share a Boss Hog Platter, which at £34.95 is reasonable value considering you get "a full selection of our finest meats including Spare and Baby Back Ribs, a Jacob's Ladder Beef Rib, Burnt Ends, Pulled Pork, Chicken Thighs and 2 smoked Sausages" as well as fries and coleslaw.

T4P8qJeiJAoG6uaazU0f1A.text: As an American living in London, life can be tough if not impossible when you can't get quality BBQ food. Bodean's certainly helps rectify the situation. Bodean's is always packed and you should always expect a queue. My favorite is the Soho special, which combines burnt ends (the house specialty) and pulled pork. Match made in heaven if you ask me. Their cornbread is also pretty decent and they have pretty good wings. I've never tried their ribs *gasp* but I have friends that swear by them. I also appreciate the North American bottled beer selection which includes Blue Moon, Coors, and Brooklyn Brewery. Of course I appreciate local British and European beers, but sometimes you just need a taste of home.

xochvxe6eKs0zGxJb2gAMw.text: Meat-Joy!!My lovely American friend told me that she was feeling sad yesterday...so I figured the best way to make her world better was to invite her out, then fill her with pulled pork and other Midwestern American food... It worked!! Her eyes lit up as soon as she saw the menu!!I had ribs & burnt ends...she had burnt ends & pulled pork. Both came with a giant pile of chips, coleslaw and we paid an extra £1.50 for corn bread. I have to admit, I had no idea what any of these things were before Bodeans, so I am very appreciative of my pork-education.Translation for other English folks that have not yet tried this kind of artery-blocking yumness:* Burnt ends:  Crispy crusty bits of brisket (mine was dark, juicy chunks of beef in a really good bbq marinade)* Pulled Pork: Slow cooked, melt in the mouth, shredded pork-joy. My friend told me to add the vinegar/spicy sauce before munching it...* Ribs: You all know this one! It's just bbq ribs in a really yummy sauce.* Corn bread: I'd never had this before...it was a bit like a savoury cake that was only improved by dunking it in meat juices.* The coleslaw isn't as mayonnaise-y as I am used to...so I really liked it. The portion sizes were immense! But they provided boxes, cups of extra sauce and lids for the coleslaw...so I have enough for lunch today as well. Woot!

JpUR73vXUaxn9qD9n88XTw.text: Been here a half dozen times,  the Soho branch is very busy so book ahead but the food is consistently amazing.  Do yourself a big favor and try the burnt ends with an alcoholic ice tea!

kTAQdxo3JBnpIOts5clyIQ.text: GREAT food. The staff are always lovely, I've never sat downstairs which apparently has a larger menu but the upstairs menu is big enough for me. Casual dining in a diner style setting, plenty to keep the eyes occupied with the various posters, trophies and 3 screens showing american sports. Would definitely recommend to meat eaters for a full on meal or a snack if just a bit peckish! Can't say I've payed much attention to the veggie options. Sorry. There's also heated outdoor seating which I have sat at in winter and it wasn't uncomfortable. They also do a variety of beers, ales and cocktails! And the sweet potato fries are AMAZING! Thumbs up all round!

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Bodeans

W8bdaZa5D74CUhk3ToeYig.text: Me and the missus met up with some out of town friends and there was only one place to eat. Seriously, they didn't want to eat anywhere else!I've now discovered that I have a limit at Bodeans. Beer and diablo hot wings fills me up just right. And anything less than diablo and you're a wimp, IMHO ;) The hot wings at the Poland Street restaurant are particularly good.As with every visit to Bodeans, the food was great and the staff were friendly. They managed to fit the four of us in to a massive table which was booked 90+ minutes after we got there so we had loads of time to eat and chill out!We tend to go to one of two of the restaurants, this one and the one at Tower Hill. Tower Hill is my favourite because it's more spacious and has beer on tap but Soho wins for convenient location.If you're never been, go. It may not be the most authentic or even the best in London but it's ALWAYS good.

gU7nRiSngY5a6AauFSxbWg.text: Reasonable prices, actually quite impressed with the prices based on it's location and fame.The food is good and plenty and you have a wide variety to chose from.So far the staff was really nice and helpful.

9qf5QR6CTgj1MBJoqvoVUQ.text: This was our first trip to Bodeans and it certainly didn't disappoint. The staff were attentive and nothing seemed too much trouble. My wife and I both swapped our sides which was very easy, I swapped my fries for chilli cheese fries which were very special. We were going to see a show and the speed of service was important and certainly didn't disappoint either.I had 1/2 Chicken with pulled pork & pork sausages. With the fries above & some coleslaw it made for an impressive platter of food. My wife had 1/2 a chicken with sides of onion rings and cornbread muffins. She also had a side of Mac & cheese....her favourite. The side of Mac & cheese was huge!! It was delicious and the sauces were very special. The staff let us know that, should we not be able to finish they would be more than happy to supply us with doggy bags. That wasn't necessary as I had fasted in anticipation of an enormous meal, also not sure how the audience of Cats would have reacted to the smell of the remains of our dinner, not to mention the cats.All in all, highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. 1/2 chicken, pulled pork, sausages, chilli cheese fries & coleslaw
Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Mac & Cheese
Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. 1/2 chicken, cornbread muffins & onion rings....yum

e9OtIOQWaQnhFKNUTN4-Vw.text: Bodeans is brilliant. My favourite place to sneak off and have a long lunch from work. American barbecue food, in a diner style downstairs, or a deli style upstairs. Or take-away. Try the Pulled Pork sandwich, with their fries and lashings of their chipotle sauce. The fries have this amazing taste that is a mixture of sugar and salt and MSG or something. God it's good. Shows American sports all day long. Ace.

k1ZN8TvmzDGrF4OS_yjE9Q.text: I used to work near this restaurant and we would eat here regularly. I really enjoyed every meal I had here. They serve big portions, so go with a healthy appetite! You need to like meat, so it's not the best place to bring a vegetarian. It's a over 2 floors - upstairs is more American fast food joint, downstairs is more of a restaurant. It's good value and I recommend the pulled pork or burnt ends (only served on certain days of the week though!)

hezUCtXI-OHOaqUlycdqpw.text: great steak house, good with kids

BGCz7OjfD0Iq86luPvFjQQ.text: The menu is 50's US diner style - meat, meat and more meat. Pork, beef, lamb, baby back ribs - i'm sure you get the picture! Prices aren't too bad considering you can get a meat filled meal for around £10-£15.

tNHI-2ceuK0XgNh9myuJHw.text: Visited for first time recently and was completely blown away by the meat platter. Massive portions, great service, best meat ive had in London,even the whole country. Going back soon.

VECbELhqNCtGCAV8MtpPRw.text: Bodeans is an great place to eat American food. I think the Soho restaurant was the first one but I have noticed more opening up around london. The food is authentic american food with great combo's and the ribs are great. It is nice to see a restauarnt like this as most of the american restaurants I have been to are Tex Mex chain restaurarnts. Ther is a diner at street level and the restaurant is downstairs. The service is friendly and good. A pleasant addition to west end eating.

2dwuIxN--_OPxc0H951-tg.text: Loved it, good fun, food and beer... just the thing for a fun night out with mates... but not a diner for two!

huRVRf6wjGfQDVDbSdMwDQ.text: I have been to this place back and back again, in a 2 to 3 weeks reoccurrence. I can honestly say that I have eaten the menu up and down and that twice, at least. The whole slap baby bag is the god of bbq ribs. No other place like this has so much flare and atmosphere as this place has, starting at the waiters and ending at the cow with only 3 legs.

GRoQsHwRoFjo9Qj1ZCK3zQ.text: Have only ever gone for lunch and then had the pulled pork and chicken platter which was tasty. However unfortunately I am one who likes quantity(childhood summers in New York) and this did not live up to the hype. however for £10 in the centre of London not bad value and definitely good for lunch when you dont have much time to spare. Only thing I would say:MORE MEAT

6yUzHWYNQWTY5JQH-UlqPQ.text: This place is great- I always think of it as good hangover food. The pulled pork sandwiches are really tasty and filling. The atmosphere is chilled out and you can buy a beer, great for a Saturday afternoon lunch/snack before facing the crowds on Oxford Street.

OHDTC-e_DQ-wNGAETrPZbA.text: This place is great (but not recommended for vegetarians). I have tried a few different dishes - the pulled pork, burger, burnt ends (wow!) and I've never been disappointed. There is a more casual upstairs section, with a restaurant downstairs. For sports fan, the TVs are usually showing American games. I just wish they offered tasty milkshakes too.

M_1eOETM_ZJaMu5rIUlNVA.text: I love Bodeans. I've been there numerous times on various visits to London. The BBQ sauce they use is amazing and way better than a lot of BBQ that I've had in the US. Weird, huh? They also have amazing cocktails. We've always sat downstairs where they have comfy booths and tables with TVs blasting various games. I have no recollection of their prices - probably due to the numerous cocktails we consumed and/or the fact that I was able to expense it! Everytime I go to London, I want to go to Bodeans - I still dream about their BBQ chicken. Yum.

ZV2e7BBumpgGYG7-SAm7aA.text: Now I'm not really a ribs kinda guy but I stumbled into this place on a night out on the beer. Well what can I say, I had the full slab of baby back ribs. Smothered in bbq sauce and with a load of added Chalula pepper sauce, they were amazing. They have a selection of beers from small American breweries plus some more well known names, a large basement dining area and seating upstairs. All this in the heart of Soho, its really good, the only weak point is their coleslaw which is a bit of an issue under the trades descriptions act as it is simply shredded carrot and cabbage with no mayo, but hey with ribs this good who cares.

Yp9j7YUVZgSRWOZYlkoCaQ.text: I hail from a place that really knows bbq so Bodeans does not - in my mind - replicate the authentic, glorious pulled pork that tastes of home.  That said, Bodeans bbq is GOOD.  And if you add the right combination of flavours from the various sauces/spices/condiments on offer, it's kind of close to being the real thing.  Plus, there is so much else worth eating here: the ribs, the burgers, the bbq caesar salad, the chicken wings, the fries, the coleslaw - all perfectly satisfying stuff.The one issue I have is that you can't get the downstairs menu unless you actually eat it downstairs.  And I don't like it downstairs.  It's windowless and usually filled with families and children, so I usually sit on stools in the fun bright upstairs and forgo the meatloaf.

5P04UvkkhNz69pJbGgWsMQ.text: the best bbq I've had outside of the USA a nice range of dishes and cocktails.You can't book though unless there r 8or more of you which was asnnoying as it's very busy!

FEVhDTBk8_SFRufMtn27Fw.text: If you can find a nicer sandwich than the soho classic from bodeans then please send me a qype message with the details cos I'll be very interested. The restaurant itself has a very nice diner kinda feel to it and the staff are very friendly but at the end of the day, it's the sandwiches/burgers which make this place stand out from the crowd!

YUIs5lupIT96rWy7AgCNHg.text: Bodeans is my favorite place to eat in London, but also one that's not for everyone. If you like meat, then you'll be in heaven; however, if you're looking for a light lunch, and variety, probably best to move along. For me, the combo is the only way to go; I think it's about £14/15, and is a huge plate of pulled pork, ribs, amazing chips and fresh coleslaw. Not the most exciting or sophisticated food ever, but it's all so tasty it doesn't matter. Definitely not a place to go if you're planning on going out after; it's killed many a night out for me, but that's possibly more down to my own gluttony. Also, not a date restaurant unless you want to see the girl/boy of your dreams working up a meat sweat. Only things I would improve would be the toilets, as they're fairly grim for a restaurant. ps. If you go, it's worth waiting for a table downstairs, as it's a bit bright upstairs and members of the public will see you sucking that last rib dry.

ldjsjjr6IyRDO3OavE3d4Q.text: Had an awesome beverage of Samuel Adams beer followed with an amazing combo of chicken & ribs with @simondoggett and @rich_Marr. Insanely awesome and we love the kitchen roll. ps. the nachos are amazing!

LU23xY-kG14rqrtWphGoTw.text: Wow I love the Soho special! I was introduced to this place a while ago and used to go every weekend pretty much. The Soho special is a must if visiting, and although the burger bun isn't 10/10 the beef and pulled pork filling and tasty fries are easily. The fries always taste best with a good coating of seasoning so if you can't see a slight orange tinge to your fries i'd ask for more and i'm sure the staff would be happy to help. The staff are friendly and often whilst ordering you find yourself getting jabbed in the back from the next customer in the queue because youre talking too much However, if it isn't busy (rare when I used to go lots) i'm sure the staff would love to stop for a moment to talk about anything. Bottomless soda Need I say more. I don't visit too often any more but only as I have found other places to enjoy, but i'm sure i'll make an appearance soon - I just can't keep away from the Soho special for long.
