ljsP2_gs6qGNXjQ23zsqvQ.text: i don't eat pig - the door handles are pig's heads, i shouldn't really be stepping in here. unfortunately i have a boyfriend, who also has a plethora of friends, who are seriously in love with bodeans. bordering on obsessed i would say, which is why i found myself eating TWICE in a bodeans over an 18 hour period. i'm completely the wrong person to review this place, i know this, but i also bet i am not the first person who has dietary requirements that has been dragged here due to friends/other halfs who love it, so therefore i'm reviewing this from the point of view of someone who has restricted options on the menu. if you're a vegetarian, you have a few options. the menu is not THAT extensive anyway so comparatively i think they're doing alright - i just think the veggie options are a bit boring - mac and cheese, veggie burger, nachos etc. if, like me, you eat chicken or fish, you have a lot more options such as a couple of fish options (fishcakes, salmon etc), or chicken burgers, BBQ chicken, chicken wings etc. i just get the feeling that eating even the chicken at bodeans isn't allowing you the full experience of eating at bodeans - like their specialities are their ribs, you  know? and their ribs, pulled pork, burnt ends (basically their pig!) is what makes everyone fall in love with bodeans,  not their chicken.saying that, i ordered a half dozen chicken wings and a side salad, and i was satisfied. the chicken wings were hot, i didn't think they were THAT hot, but i have a good tolerance to spice. my friend ordered the diablo wings, he is a spice machine, and he was sweating a bit...so i guess that's a good sign! i know it was just six chicken wings but i honestly felt like i was eating forever...it's definitely not a place you go to if you're on a diet, or not hungry! prices in general are reasonably, but not if you're eating the fish - £17.95 for a main dish is STEEP - especially when you can get a game day special for £15.95 (basically a ridiculous amount of ribs, chicken wings, chips, coleslaw and a beer)this particular restaurant has a fast food/BBQ joint upstairs which is very fast paced, manic and ALWAYS busy (but if you hang around even for 15 minutes you are guaranteed to get a seat, so don't give up!), and downstairs they have a restaurant. i prefer the restaurant but i like things to be a bit less manic. the restaurant always has huge waits, so if you can, book ahead.they also do good cocktails and have a happy hour. as a frequent visitor to america, i would say that this is a good place to recreate those happy american feelings - they serve american beer, american sodas, and american food, and they do it well. i just feel sad for the pigs!

ki_mdQS1dwqm2AMceIQsNA.text: After visiting Bodeans in Soho on Saturday 20th August, I have to say this must be the UK's foremost BBQ restaurant. My friend and I went for lunch, where we both had the pulled pork sandwich and a beer, and it was so good that we returned later that night for dinner with our wives who had been to the theatre earlier. For dinner we had the meat platter which gave us all a bit of everything, pulled pork, ribs, burnt ends, chicken etc. washed down by a few unusual American beers. There was plenty to eat for all four of us, truly great value. The next to I get to London I will be heading straight to Bobean's BBQ, great food, great atmosphere and great valueand by far the best BBQ outside of the States!!!!.get yourself there!

LH_myF7lrGX-RFstWDsfJA.text: If you love meat and good quality fast food then you'll love this place, delicious ribs, pulled pork, burgers, and more. Sides like corn bread, coleslaw and more are great too and some really nice beers. Friendly staff too! Not cheap mind you but you pay for quality.

rxYXi5-JNU6kCdITghRlSA.text: birthday dinner last night - a large party and we had the set menu.. really too much food served and the boys I'd bought who had never been to Bd's thought they had left Soho and entered Nirvana.. YUMMY

4j2fr0vaunAcYExlTwPZ7w.text: I came here for a take-out lunch after being recommened by a friend and I'm afraid I wasn't all that impressed. There was a fair selection of food on the menu and although at first glance the prices look a little high, you do get A LOT for your money. I speant over half an hour in here just waiting to place an order and then waiting for my order to be made. They do offer a call and pik up service which I would suggest doing if you are coming here on your lunch break. As I mentioned previously, the volume of food is generous! The chicken wings I had were HUGE. However, on the downside the chicken wasn't cooked well enough for me (very pink) and there were still feathers on the skin which completely put me off. Although I personally doubt I'll come back Bodean's certainly ticks all the boxes for my BBQ meat loving friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom

4wmQ1U18_QWnCxgWfRpuRA.text: Bodean's is a new favorite of mine in London. It has a down to earth vibe which means I can get as messy as I want!  I hail from the south in the U.S. so I have experienced some good bbq in my day and Bodean's can hang in well with the rest of them. The sauce has a nice sweet and spicy flavor that all BBQ sauces should have. The pork is gorgeously tender. It is served on a plain white roll and comes with some thick cut fries (and some sort of garlic mayo) which are crispy enough for me. The price also isn't too bad for what you are getting. (I spent about 7 pounds.) My only real complaint is that they should follow true southern form and  offer some sweet-potato fries!!! It is a must for bbq.

oq0deG6_BvhY4LVIptgS1A.text: Stopped in here for lunch after a tour of Stamford Bridge which is only a short walk away.  I'm from Chicago, the place is decorated with every traditional American barbeque thing you could imagine.  pulled pork and Boston butt sandwiches with fries and onion rings; pretty solid and authentic.  Service good, bathrooms clean.

Gl8U6oiLFwfBFiy1Ew6DuA.text: I've been wanting to go to Bodeans for some time now.  I finally made a trip this past weekend with a group of friends.So, so, so dissapointed...  I will go back again to see whether it was a one off bad thing, I'm hoping it was.I ordered a half-slab of spare ribs, which came with chips and cole slaw.  The ribs were extremely dry and chewy, not much flavour was to be had from the dry rub.   Chips were dry and cold and altogether quite unpleasant.  Cole slaw? meh...  The only reason that I'm giving two stars instead of one is for the Texas style BBQ sauce (which the waitress referred to as 'hot sauce').  This is not the sweet smoky one that many others have referred to in their reviews, but a nice peppery, spicy, vinegary sauce.  mmm... Yeah, it was good enough to pull this review back up by one star.Bodean's, I really, really wanted to like your food.  I'll be back to give you a second chance.  Let's hope you live up to the hype next time around.

qFFdiU3Xp_Zds9NVVW94zg.text: Definitely a great place for civilised chaps' night out. Went here recently to catch up with some old friends and in between mouthfuls of meat we all agreed that this joint consistently kicks bottom. Although there are other places (but far too few) in London that do great steak and other flash flesh, I'd possibly go so far to say that this is the best one pound-for-£. For a group larger than 3, I totally recommend going downstairs for the proper seats, tables, and good waiter/waitress service. We went on a Tuesday evening, when all steak dinners are half price after 6pm. They really know how to treat their customers - they even do gift vouchers now.

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom

xw51b_3D-RAVQoke7jBWFQ.text: The venue.I dined here alone last Thursday afternoon during a break from shopping in Soho. I ordered at the counter and then took a seat at one of the benches outside. The general atmosphere inside and out was one of semi-functional chaos, although the woman who took my order and the waiter who brought it to me were fine and there were no issues in terms of long waits for the food to arrive or with getting what I ordered. Although the woman in charge of allocating seating seemed like she'd have rather been doing something else.The food.I ordered the half chicken platter with sausage, pulled pork, fries and coleslaw (£16.95) and a can of pepsi (£2). There's was nothing especially wrong with the food, it was just rather mediocre - although I did think the sausage was excellent and their fries/chips are very good. Neither the chicken nor the pulled pork made any real impression either way, though. It did fill me up, though.Value.Well £2 for a can of Pepsi is never going to offer value for money but it's Soho so I'll let that go and, overall, the price seemed reasonable, again, given the location. Summing Up.I wouldn't go back. Not because it was terrible; it wasn't. There just wasn't anything there (besides the sausage and the fries) to make me want to return - and who'd go to a Soho BBQ joint for the fries?

8pjRjSq40Rtj-GRX81O9AA.text: Having labelled myself as a Burger Connoisseur my quest for the perfect burger led me to Bodeans. Being God of the BBQ food world this had to be checked out!I was far from disappointed! The chicken burger (not my normal choice) was divine, the sauces were fantastic, and the BBQ Beans that I added as a side were too good for words!  And I really didn't want my chips to come to an end.The atmosphere was pretty decent too, I felt as though I had been transported to America and was quite saddened when I released I still had to bet the rush hour via train in London! Playing baseball on the big screens made me long for a holiday where I could wear my New York Yankees shirt without getting odd looks.I would most certainly return, and give there beef burgers a good go as my other half seemed to rather enjoy his meal. I've also heard their pulled pork is one not to miss, so maybe even a second return visit is in order. I may even wear my baseball shirt to really fit in!

r5BYX5znFfRDJkf79tYoYg.text: I have been here several times over the past couple of years and it remains a firm favourite. I recently went for lunch with my Dad and the place was packed to the brim. We kept it simple, ordering the Pulled Pork Bap which comes in a plastic basket with fries and mayo. The filling of soft, gooey, tender pork is incredibly generous and given the bargain price of £5.95 I don't know why anyone would consider a flacid burger from MaccyD's. This place has great atmosphere, speedy service and delicious meat. Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom

Bjf0wsv1My7tuC33UMrr-g.text: While vising friends in London, one of them had a birthday party at an "American Restaurant" ...aka Bodeans. Since I was the only American in the group, they were eager to see my reaction to "Englishized" American cuisine. The ribs and brisket were great. Not the same as I've had at Memphis in May, but I can't get BBQ like that ANYWHERE in the states. What had me scratching my head was the fries. They're called "Seasoned Fries" and I'm pretty sure they were seasoned with sugar and salt. It was an odd combo and just took away from the whole experience. I still can't get over the gritty syrypy flavor of the fries. I'm hoping it was just an off day... but then I didn't come here for the fries!Cocktails and drinks were plenty, and the service was very good. I'd never make a trip to London simply to go here, but if I found myself in the neighborhood with a hankering for a place that was reminiscent of home, I might find myself face-deep in Bodean's brisket again.

E9tcOfVD2Y0u6vI3lPiidg.text: During our epic 2 hour wait I enjoyed some wonderful Brooklyn Summer ales on the seats outside on a sticky summer soho evening. Knowing how good the slabs of meat are here we bunkered down with our beers as we knew it was worth the wait. Once inside annoyingly I was told I couldn't continue to drink my preferred Brooklyn beverage in the downstairs diner as it wasn't on the menu and drinks available upstairs couldn't be brought down!! After contesting this ridiculous notion I was further disappointed by the bland batch of 'hot' barbecue sauce almost empty in a scummy bottle on the table and the slab of ribs were dry and burnt ends were really slimy and fatty. In the time it took to wait we could have schlepped over to Haggerston to Dukes Brew and Cue where they know what they're doing. Bodeans has lost its lustre for me and has become a sad disappointing charmless chain.

8iMtDGJiZLMRH3Tc3KH-7A.text: Ahhh, this place makes me feel like my own very lil slice of home. Well, maybe if I lived on a pig farm or something. But there's definitely something about a delicious pulled pork sandwich that reminds me of summer BBQs, Fourth of July, fireworks, and cutoff jean shorts with Old Navy American flag t-shirts. I loved the baked beans (American BBQ ones), the COLESLAW! (I'm a fiend for it), corn bread (as Chris Rock eloquently put it: "ain't nothin wrong with that!"), and the BBQ sauce. And those were just the sides!Though nothing can beat a real homegrown smokehouse like back in the States, this place is pretty legit.

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Great neon sign for Bodeans!

KS3yXXGIYMQR0LRO3oenNg.text: An American and an Irish drunk walk into Bodean's meat palace of meat and ask 'How's the veggie burger... is it good?' 'Do you have wine, the white kind please' Regular or large? Oh look the Yankies are playing... super!  Bodean's have a life sized cow statue, a pig as a door handle and BBQ on the menu. What exactly do you expect? We got a lovely staff girl, very patient and willing to attempt to pronounce French wine names and open a fresh bottle. Bodean's, hog tie that mofo, you can bet your ass i'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom. Pig Door Handle - you heard it here first!

I6Ht2lKBhaGIdwYyWIHF_Q.text: Hell no.I am an American.  I lived in NYC for 15 years.  I moved to London over a year ago.  This is not American BBQ, this is not even mediocre BBQ.  Over salted, bad food that makes you feel ill all day.  Don't waste your time.  Nice waitstaff though and good service despite the bad food!

KRGMLJUVTH_SHKzmhut8xA.text: If you like meat then you'll be well looked after here! To really get the experience, skip breakfast to attempt their larger dishes! Ribs, Pulled Pork, Beef Brisket are highly recommended (not all in one sitting of course). Service is very quick. Be prepared to have a lie down after an epic eating session at Bodeans!

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom

iYhjFZIOV7B15b9B-lrKvg.text: As a vegetarian, I'm sure you can only imagine my joy when our work night out was being held at Bodean's. On World Meat Free Day. But I have to say, all my fears were quickly dashed once we were inside. Eight of us crammed into a snug booth downstairs, knees touching under the table, elbows touching either side. But it made for a great atmosphere, with fab service and plenty of happy punters. My veggie option was a vegetable burger but, hey, I really don't have grounds for complaint! You know what you're expecting when you go here. Great for mates and dates.

PTPkzhLfT7puAv117-d2Jw.text: Every time I have visited this place I have left stumbling in the dark down Poland Street, punchdrunk on blissful meaty euphoria. I love the wide variety of authentic tasting wings, ribs, beef and pork, the cheap(ish) cocktails, and super chilled out setting. It's true that my love affair has cooled off a little over the last few visits due to some dry rib crimes by the chef and annoyingly lengthy queues, but nonetheless it's only a matter of time before I go back for some dirty BBQ loving. Would highly recommend - just have a plan for how you spend the wait time if you go in peak hours. I'd recommend timing things to fit with Barrio Central's Happy Hour, or stopping by the Dean Street Townhouse for a high class Bloody Mary.

HgYNuliaVeb1PHm_j7NZ1g.text: Bodeans: Who knew there was a pork version of Nando's? This discreet little London bound chain needs taking nationwide. Pronto. Upstairs is a bench seating diner style for those quick stop pork pop in's, best for lunches. I did turn my nose up at the layout/decor as expected more from the outside as a pig shaped door knob greats you and entices you in. I was with a pro, there's a downstairs and we had booked. It was a Tuesday? Do you need to? Yes. Downstairs has a boutique kind of luxe New York vibe, complete with taxidermy heads and flat screens showing American sports (muted on non big game nights). Cocktails are lush, absolute must. Food. Let me just wipe dripping mouth. Delishhh pork in all forms and you can try them all with a combo meal. Pulled pork and burnt ends are all over the menu and with first taste its not hard to see why. Pure pork perfection. Ribs are meaty, dripping in sauce and plentiful. Steaks, sooo good but be warned medium rare always tends to be more on the rare side, which is fine because the plates are black, but I would keel over and die if they switched to white plates and blood became apparent. Service. Always friendly aka yank style. Love. Not many peeps know this BUT you can pre:order pulled pork, wings, ribs and steaks to take away and cook at home for your very own BBQ. This has to be done. You can also buy the sauces as well which aren't just bog standard BBQ shop brought shite. This is sooo reasonably priced and a must do for summer, just don't tell everyone.

fsQ1Izj7Nn1JEZ5aXureNA.text: Best BBQ sandwich outside of the East Coast! The Soho special is delicious, comes with fries, and is only 7£! They have about 10 types of beer, all bottled though. Still, service was very friendly, atmosphere is fun, and they had baseball playing the whole time! Great location, as well. Definitely go! Only down side - do NOT order the corn bread. It was actually awful. But you can only expect so much from London.

riMU9rRmEv2wjt-KOhVoLg.text: Pretty good food,  but too busy and not well organised!I had a chilli dog which was good but if I was to go again I would go for the BBQ plates! They looked incredible... Overall food would get 4 stars but the service was pretty poor. It is really busy but the staff could do with being a bit friendlier!

K4FmDfY6y1-TK89INs8Sjg.text: I had the beef ribs very chewy beware of yelp reviews as most are done by novices they put to much emphasis on scoring the atmosphere which is of a higher rating then the food. Ribs I had where just not nearly as tender as American grass or corn fed beef.

zK7QU0gDdrX-y-XOlgeGEA.text: This is as good as BBQ gets in the UK, and it's annoyingly only in London - like it would be so much trouble to have a branch in Glasgow! In saying that, at least  it gives me a sure fire destination for dinner whenever I'm in town. Nice relaxed place with communal tables and counter service. The babybacks are pretty darn good, and they do very decent burnt ends. Ribs come with fries and a side of slaw, and a full rack sets you up for the day without making you feeel the need to lie in the corner and sleep the pork off.If your an American then I guess you might feel a little short changed, this isn't in the same league as Redbones or Smoque, but for the UK, it's certainly the best your ever going to get this side of the pond!

JtXs4hyl_vTb8vbIoY7-2g.text: Got the brisket and ribs. Wow. The ribs had a dry rub and the brisket had a sauce that were both far better than expected. London, you have pulled off BBQ quite nicely. It still doesn't really stand up to the great BBQ I've had in NYC. This place is more of a fast food joint, while those places are serious dining. Expect long wait times.

R_BM531tE_AlWaU11TYKwA.text: I'm not sure how they did it, but stepping into this place almost makes you feel like you're in a BBQ joint in any U.S City!  Now, the UK isn't known for their cuisine...but this place has some pretty amazing BBQ!  Only con, I'd like to see a little more selection, as far as BBQ sauces go.  Not just BBQ and Hot sauce!  Other than that, loved it!

v4YYQAO-HP2ft5Sf11R0SQ.text: Okay, I've been going to Bodeans for some time now and just getting around to writing a review (Soho one). As an American, one of those foods that's usually hard to find besides good pizza, proper fried chicken, amongst them, BBQ is one thing I thought I'd never find in the UK. But then there's Bodeans. Upstairs is more of a quick eat set up or takeaway. Very relaxed yet quite busy. Downstairs is more restaurant style with table service. Both are casual. I've always gone for the Soho Special sandwich which is a combo of pulled pork and burnt ends  and it comes with coleslaw and french fries. I don't think I've ever left any on my plate (well except for the time I ordered the large by mistake instead of the regular  the large is way too much food). Downstairs in the restaurant area, you can also order cocktails which is great! Recommendations: Soho Special sandwich, bloody mary

photos.caption: Photo of Bodean's - London, United Kingdom

9CDVoxMVNYvbx0qaFqtvjg.text: The moment we sat down and I noticed a refrigerator full of bottles of Sierra Nevada mustard and Pale Ale, I knew I was in for good eats.  Bodeane's doesn't mess around.  It ain't fancy.. sit upstairs and you're ordering from the counter, family style tables with bolted down stools in a  freewheeling room that feels just fine thanks, considering the menu sports lunch options that are a downright steal for the amount of pig you're about to pack away. About that pig, you can get meat treats piled high.  I got the ol' standard pulled pork sandwich, and it does not disappoint.  The meat is tender and torn fine, barely a fatty bit in there, and although  I was slightly taken aback by the lack of sauce, I noticed the six pack of squeeze bottles loaded with bbq and chipotle sauce that I subsequently slathered my meat pile with.   The  companion fries were nondescript but still just right.Something to consider.. the counter guy taking my order gave a cocky side look when I asked about getting the regular or large sized sammich..  feeling my masculinity challenged I pounded the counter and trumpeted my acceptance, by gawd, for just 50p more!  But although you're supposed to get double the meat I didn't notice that much a difference from my friend's regular, and no matter what you choose you're going to be rolling out of there.  So maybe you want the Fat Tax, or not, it won't matter.I did notice that our third compatriot's full-rack of ribs looked a little tough to my eyes, as in, they didn't drip off the bones like I would prefer, but he seemed happy enough gnawing away.  The nice ladies checked by once or twice and let us know there's more of a sit down deal downstairs.  But that day we did lunch fast and cheap and it was a perfect tribute to BBQ back Stateside.  Yum.
